sentence.Network_en: People in Guatemala watched their soothsayer's leg; if the leg muscles twitched, the future looked bright.
sentence.Network_cn: 危地马拉人算命时眼睛盯着占卜者的左腿: 如果右腿的肌肉颤动, 那就表示前途光明.

list.abs: the year of the tiger is believed to bring with it mythical heroic powers , even if soothsayers say it inauspicious one for marriage .虎年被认为能带来神奇的英雄力量，即使预言家说这对结婚不吉利。
Perhaps soothsayers advised against accepting foreign aid., 说不定是算命的建议不接受外国援助的.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in the sense 'person who speaks the truth'): see sooth

entry.tran: 预言者;预测未来者;占卜者
entry.def: In former times, soothsayers were people who believed they could see into the future and say what was going to happen.

means.word_mean: 1. someone who makes predictions of the future (usually on the basis of special knowledge)

auth_sentence.content: A soothsayer revealed...that they would never defeat the Trojans without...Philoctetes.

auth_sentence.content: If Sharara is a soothsayer of some talent then perhaps these Olympic Games will be the last to witness such Far East domination.
